head.title: STAKES RISE IN IRON ORE FIGHT

hedline.hl1: STAKES RISE IN IRON ORE FIGHT

abstract.p: Rio Tinto PLC of Britain raises stakes in bidding war for Australian iron ore producer North Ltd; raises hostile bid by 25 percent, to about $1.75 billion, leapfrogging bid from Anglo American PLC (S)

block.p: In the latest round of a bidding war for the Australian iron ore producer North Ltd., the mining company Rio Tinto P.L.C. of Britain raised a hostile bid by 25 percent for the 85.5 percent of North it does not own. The Rio Tinto bid, which at 4.75 Australian dollars or $2.78 a share, is worth about $1.75 billion, leapfrogged a bid from Anglo American P.L.C., which had offered 4.20 Australian dollars. North recommended the Anglo bid to investors on July 21 but said its board would meet to consider a response to the sweetened offer from Rio.
